tool.name: pal_finder
tool.description: Find microsatellite repeat elements sequencing reads and design PCR primers to amplify them
tool.command: pal_finder_wrapper.sh #if str( $platform.platform_type ) == "illumina" "$platform.input_fastq_r1" "$platform.input_fastq_r2" #else --454 "$platform.input_fasta" #end if $output_microsat_summary $output_pal_summary #if str( $platform.platform_type ) == "illumina" and $platform.filter_microsats --filter_microsats "$output_filtered_microsats" #end if #if $keep_config_file --output_config_file "$output_config_file" #end if --primer-prefix "$primer_prefix" --2merMinReps $min_2mer_repeats --3merMinReps $min_3mer_repeats --4merMinReps $min_4mer_repeats --5merMinReps $min_5mer_repeats --6merMinReps $min_6mer_repeats #if str( $primer.primer_options ) == "custom" --primer-opt-size $primer.primer_opt_size --primer-min-size $primer.primer_min_size --primer-max-size $primer.primer_max_size --primer-min-gc $primer.primer_min_gc --primer-max-gc $primer.primer_max_gc --primer-gc-clamp $primer.primer_gc_clamp --primer-max-end-gc $primer.primer_max_end_gc --primer-min-tm $primer.primer_min_tm --primer-max-tm $primer.primer_max_tm --primer-opt-tm $primer.primer_opt_tm --primer-pair-max-diff-tm $primer.primer_pair_max_diff_tm #end if #if str( $mispriming.mispriming_options ) == "custom" --primer-mispriming-library $mispriming.mispriming_library #end if

param.name: primer_prefix
param.label: Primer prefix
param.help: This prefix will be added to the beginning of all primer names

param.name: platform_type
param.label: Sequencing platform used to generate data
param.help: Currently pal_finder only handles Illumina paired-end reads and 454 single-end reads

param.name: input_fastq_r1
param.label: Illumina fastq file (read 1)

param.name: input_fastq_r2
param.label: Illumina fastq file (read 2)

param.name: filter_microsats
param.label: Filter and sort the microsatellites
param.help: Filter pal_finder results to only include lines with primer sequences and remove non-perfect repeats

param.name: input_fasta
param.label: 454 fasta file with raw reads

param.name: min_2mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 2-mer repeat units to detect
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_3mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 3-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_4mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 4-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_5mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 5-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_6mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 6-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: mispriming_options
param.label: Mispriming library to use
param.help: Specify file of nucleotide sequences to avoid amplifying (PRIMER_MISPRIMING_LIBRARY)

param.name: mispriming_library
param.label: Select mispriming library from history
param.help: Fasta file containing sequences to avoid amplifying

param.name: primer_options
param.label: Primer settings to use
param.help: Advanced users can customise the settings for primer3 for more control

param.name: primer_opt_size
param.label: Optimum length (in bases) of a primer (PRIMER_OPT_SIZE)
param.help: Primer3 will attempt to pick primers close to this length

param.name: primer_min_size
param.label: Minimum acceptable length (in bases) of a primer (PRIMER_MIN_SIZE)
param.help: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to PRIMER_MAX_SIZE

param.name: primer_max_size
param.label: Maximum acceptable length (in bases) of a primer (PRIMER_MAX_SIZE)
param.help: Currently this parameter cannot be larger than 35. This limit is governed by maximum oligo size for which primer3's melting-temperature is valid

param.name: primer_min_gc
param.label: Minimum allowable percentage of Gs and Cs in any primer (PRIMER_MIN_GC)

param.name: primer_max_gc
param.label: Maximum allowable percentage of Gs and Cs in any primer (PRIMER_MAX_GC)

param.name: primer_gc_clamp
param.label: Specify number of consecutive Gs and Cs at 3' end of both the left and right primer (PRIMER_GC_CLAMP)

param.name: primer_max_end_gc
param.label: Maximum number of Gs or Cs allowed in last five 3' bases of a left or right primer (PRIMER_MAX_END_GC)

param.name: primer_min_tm
param.label: Minimum acceptable melting temperature for a primer oligo (PRIMER_MIN_TM)
param.help: Temperature should be in degrees Celsius

param.name: primer_max_tm
param.label: Maximum acceptable melting temperature for a primer oligo (PRIMER_MAX_TM)
param.help: Temperature should be in degrees Celsius

param.name: primer_opt_tm
param.label: Optimum melting temperature for a primer (PRIMER_OPT_TM)
param.help: Temperature should be in degrees Celsius

param.name: primer_pair_max_diff_tm
param.label: Maximum acceptable difference between melting temperatures of left and right primers (PRIMER_PAIR_MAX_DIFF_TM)
param.help: Temperature should be in degrees Celsius

param.name: keep_config_file
param.label: Output the config file to the history
param.help: Can be used to run pal_finder outside of Galaxy

data.name: output_pal_summary
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string} for ${primer_prefix} (microsatellites with read IDs and primer pairs)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool runs the pal_finder program, which finds microsatellite repeat elements directly from raw 454 or Illumina paired-end sequencing reads. It then designs PCR primers to amplify these repeat loci (Potentially Amplifiable Loci: PAL).
Optionally for Illumina data, the output from pal_finder can also be filtered to remove any motifs without primer sequences, and with non-perfect microsatellites. The microsatellites are then ranked by motif size (largest to smallest).
Pal_finder runs the primer3_core program; information on the settings used in primer3_core can be found in the Primer3 manual at http://primer3.sourceforge.net/primer3_manual.htm
-------------
.. class:: infomark
**Credits**
This Galaxy tool has been developed by Peter Briggs within the Bioinformatics Core Facility at the University of Manchester. It runs the pal_finder package which can be obtained from http://sourceforge.net/projects/palfinder/:
* PLoS One. 2012; 7(2): e30953 "Rapid Microsatellite Identification from Illumina Paired-End Genomic Sequencing in Two Birds and a Snake" Todd A. Castoe, Alexander W. Poole, A. P. Jason de Koning, Kenneth L. Jones, Diana F. Tomback, Sara J. Oyler-McCance, Jennifer A. Fike, Stacey L. Lance, Jeffrey W. Streicher, Eric N. Smith, and David D. Pollock
The paper is available at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3279355/
This tool is compatible with pal_finder version 0.02.04, which in turn runs the primer3_core program (version 2.0.0-alpha is required, available from http://primer3.sourceforge.net/releases.php):
* Steve Rozen and Helen J. Skaletsky (2000) "Primer3 on the WWW for general users and for biologist programmers". In: Krawetz S, Misener S (eds) Bioinformatics Methods and Protocols: Methods in Molecular Biology. Humana Press, Totowa, NJ, pp 365-386
The paper is available at http://purl.com/STEVEROZEN/papers/rozen-and-skaletsky-2000-primer3.pdf
The filtering and sorting of the pal_finder output for Illumina data is performed using a Perl script written by Graeme Fox at the University of Manchester, and which is included with this tool.
Please kindly acknowledge both this Galaxy tool, the pal_finder and primer3 packages, and the utility script if you use it in your work.
